English (United States)(en-US): Let’s say there’s a party held especially for you.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 너만을 위한 파티가 준비되었다고 해 보자.

English (United States)(en-US): <name>, what would you\ndo at this amazing party?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): <nickname>. 네가 바라는 최고의\n파티는 어떤 모습이야?

English (United States)(en-US): I would sing my favorite song.|I would be in the corner, clapping sincerely.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 갈고 닦은 노래 한 소절을 보여 줄래.|난… 구석에서… 진심 어린 박수를 칠래.

English (United States)(en-US): And?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그리고?

English (United States)(en-US): And what?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그리고라니?

English (United States)(en-US): Mm, I did hear a song with a peculiar beat and\nsee people clap at the party I observed today.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 음, 내가 오늘 보고 온 파티에서도 박자가\n튀는 노래가 들리고 쏟아지는 갈채가 보였지.

English (United States)(en-US): And everyone invited seemed happy.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그리고 자리에 모인 모두가 행복해 보였어.

English (United States)(en-US): But…
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그런데…

English (United States)(en-US): Dot, you had a fun human experience!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 뭉치, 신나는 인간 문화를 체험하고 왔구나?

English (United States)(en-US): Your walk must have been very enjoyable.|But you don’t seem satisfied.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 즐거운 산책 시간을 보내서 기뻤겠네.|어쩐지 뭉치가 기뻐 보이지는 않는 걸.

English (United States)(en-US): Your walk must have been very enjoyable.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 즐거운 산책 시간을 보내서 기뻤겠네.

English (United States)(en-US): What are you saying? You actually\nthink I would feel joy from that?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 무슨 소리야? 내가 그걸 보고 기쁨을 느낄 것 같아?

English (United States)(en-US): Wh, what’s wrong, Dot?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 뭉치야. 왜, 왜 그래?

English (United States)(en-US): I’m sorry, I didn’t clarify the situation. But\nwhat I witnessed was so cold-blooded.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 설명이 모자랐지, 미안해. 하지만 내가 본 건\n정말이지 처음 마주한 비정한 광경이었어.

English (United States)(en-US): But you don’t seem satisfied.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 어쩐지 뭉치가 기뻐 보이지는 않는 걸.

English (United States)(en-US): You’re right. It’s hard to keep\nany secrets from you, <name>.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 응 맞아. 이렇게나 알아주다니 <nickname>에게\n비밀 같은 건 앞으로도 못 만들겠네.

English (United States)(en-US): This party was impossible to appreciate.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 도저히 기뻐할 수가 없는 파티였어.

English (United States)(en-US): Before you arrived, I was\nthinking about your species.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 네가 오기 전까지 너희 인간에\n대해 생각하고 있었어.

English (United States)(en-US): About the party, yes, but really\nabout the death that came after.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 파티 좋지. 하지만 그 후에 찾아온 죽음에 대해.

English (United States)(en-US): Death is a moment of misfortune\nclaiming a life, right?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 죽음이란 말이야, 한순간의\n불운이 생을 앗아가는 것이지?

English (United States)(en-US): It’s hard to believe that someone’s invaluable\nlife ends according to mere lottery results.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 고귀한 인간의 삶이 고작 무작위\n추첨으로 끝나는 거였다니.

English (United States)(en-US): Are you disappointed in us?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 우리에게 실망했어?

English (United States)(en-US): No. Yet you go on living, holding parties.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 아니, 그런데도 파티와 함께 살아간다니.

English (United States)(en-US): Romantic. How fleeting and beautiful!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 낭만적이야. 그건 꽤나 덧없고도, 아름다운 것 같아!

English (United States)(en-US): Huh? Wait, Dot.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 응? 잠깐만, 뭉치야.

English (United States)(en-US): (Dot seems to be confused…)
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): (뭉치는 뭔가를 오해하고 있는 것 같아…)

English (United States)(en-US): Not all deaths are coincidental.|Death is not as romantic as you think.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 모든 죽음이 우연한 것은 아니야.|죽음은 네 생각만큼 낭만적인 것이 아니야.

English (United States)(en-US): Huh?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 어, 어?

English (United States)(en-US): Then what is human death according to you?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그러면 네가 알고 있는 인간의\n죽음이란 건 어떤 거야?

English (United States)(en-US): Everyone dies.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 모든 인간은 반드시 죽게 되어 있어.

English (United States)(en-US): Due to irreversible accidents,\nterminal illnesses, or simply old age…
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 손을 쓸 수 없는 사고를 당한다거나, 돌이킬 수\n없는 병에 걸린다거나, 단지 수명을 다한다거나.

English (United States)(en-US): The ways vary but we are all destined\nto turn to dust six feet under.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 방식은 다양하지만 우리는 모두 언젠가\n백골이 되어 땅에 스며들게 될 테지.

English (United States)(en-US): What?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 뭐?

English (United States)(en-US): No. And… ‘destined?’
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그럴 수가. 그리고… ‘언젠가’라니.

English (United States)(en-US): You thought of it as a literal lottery?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 정말 뽑기 같은 걸로 받아들이고 있었던 거구나?

English (United States)(en-US): Other alternatives simply couldn’t be!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그럴 리가 없다고 생각했어!

English (United States)(en-US): I couldn’t even imagine that you were going\nthrough something so horrifying, <name>!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그야 말이지, <nickname>. 네가 그런 무서운\n일을 겪고 있다곤 상상조차 못했어!

English (United States)(en-US): Not knowing when you will die,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 언제 네가 죽을지 알 수 없다면,

English (United States)(en-US): how are you not crawling on the floor every\nsecond, frightened out of your mind?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 너는 어떻게 겁에 질려 바닥을\n기면서 살아가지 않는 거야?

English (United States)(en-US): Every step you take must feel as if\nyou are about to fall into a sinkhole.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 매순간 떼는 발걸음이 싱크 홀을\n눈앞에 둔 것만 같은 기분이지 않겠어?

English (United States)(en-US): Hm, it’s not easy to explain simply but…\nwe are not scared every single moment.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 음, 딱 잘라 설명하기는 어렵지만…\n우리가 매순간 두려워하지는 않아.

English (United States)(en-US): Are humans so incredible that they\ncan ignore the fear of their extinction?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 인간은 너무나도 대단해서 존재가\n소멸하는 공포조차 느끼지 못하는 건가?

English (United States)(en-US): If so, I could maybe understand it.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그런 거라면 사실 받아들일 수 있을지도.

English (United States)(en-US): No, Dot.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 아니야 뭉치야.

English (United States)(en-US): It’s that we aren’t normally aware\nof death in our everyday lives.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 우리는 평상시에 죽음을 인지하지\n않고 살아갈 때가 많은 것뿐이야.

English (United States)(en-US): But when my mind wanders late at night,\nor when news of a fatal crash arrives…
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 하지만 밤에 누워서 공상에 잠길 때나,\n누군가의 사고 소식을 접했을 때라면…

English (United States)(en-US): Death becomes real. That is… beyond fear.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 죽음을 두려워하기도 해.\n그건 정말… 무서운 일이야.

English (United States)(en-US): R, Really?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그, 그래?

English (United States)(en-US): Then, then…
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그렇다면, 그렇다면…

English (United States)(en-US): (Wait for Dot to fully accept this fact.)
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): (뭉치도 받아들일 때까지 기다려 주자.)

English (United States)(en-US): <name>.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): <nickname>.

English (United States)(en-US): Yes?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 왜 그래?

English (United States)(en-US): I want to hear you confirm this in your own\nwords… Will you die someday as well?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 있지, 너의 언어로 확신을 줬으면 하는 게 있어…\n그러면 너도 언젠가는 죽을 수 있는 거야?

English (United States)(en-US): Yes, I will too.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 나도 언젠가는 죽게 되겠지.

English (United States)(en-US): Give it another thought. That does\nnot have to be the case, does it?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 잘 생각해 봐. 그렇지는 않을 걸? 죽음이 오늘의\n파티처럼, 그래, 암흑 왕의 축제라고 생각해 보자.

English (United States)(en-US): Can’t you obtain a special immunity\nof some sorts from the underworld?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 너에게 주어진 면제권 같은 건 없어?

English (United States)(en-US): Destiny isn’t going to grant me\nthat kind of special treatment.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): (나는 운명에게 그 정도까지 특별 대우를 받는 사람은 아니야.)

English (United States)(en-US): What’s making you ignore the truth?|How special of a human do you think I am?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 왜 다 알면서도 갑자기 눈을 돌리는 거야?|나를 어떤 특별한 인간으로 생각하고 있는 거야?

English (United States)(en-US): I’m just another human being\nthat happens to be your friend.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 나는 그저 너와 친구가 된 인간 A일 뿐인 걸.

English (United States)(en-US): Ah.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 으으.

English (United States)(en-US): Ah… I’m sorry.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 으으… 미안해…

English (United States)(en-US): But it’s difficult to accept.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 하지만 받아들이기 힘들어.

English (United States)(en-US): Even you, my lovable human,\nare walking towards death.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 나의 사랑스러운 인간인 너마저\n죽음을 향해 걷는 존재였다니.

English (United States)(en-US): How do you bear it when the\nhorror of death grips you?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 죽음에 대한 공포에 사로잡힐 때면,\n너는 대체 어떻게 견딜 수 있었어?

English (United States)(en-US): When I think of the pain of\nexistential terror you have suffered…
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 지혜로운 네가 겪었을, 존재의\n불안에 대한 고통을 떠올리면…

English (United States)(en-US): I ache for you. Truly… I ache.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 가엾구나. 가엾어. 정말로… 가엾어서 그래.

English (United States)(en-US): (It’s comforting to be existentially consoled by an alien dust monster.)|(I mean, is Dot pitying me right now?)
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): (외계 먼지 괴물에게 받는 존재론적인 위로… 위안이 돼.)|(뭐야, 뭉치가 지금 나를 동정하고 있는 건가?)

English (United States)(en-US): <name>. One thought hasn’t changed, though.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): <name>. 하지만 나 변하지 않은 생각이 하나 있어.

English (United States)(en-US): Humans are creatures of romance.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 너희 인간이 낭만적인 생물이라는 것.

English (United States)(en-US): Born to die, you face your fleeting existences and\nlive on. Even when you think you haven’t chosen to.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 예비 사체이면서도, 덧없는 운명을 받아들이고 살아가는\n쪽을 고르지. 고르지 않았다고 생각할 때조차 말이야.

English (United States)(en-US): That is truly beautiful.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그건 정말로 아름다운 일이야.

English (United States)(en-US): I already cherished humans. But I’ll cherish you\neven more so from today, for that very reason.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 나는 그런 인간을 동경해. 오늘로\n더욱 그렇게 생각하게 됐어.

English (United States)(en-US): Dot…
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 뭉치야…

English (United States)(en-US): I talked too much today, didn’t I?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 오늘 내가 말을 너무 많이 했다, 그렇지?

English (United States)(en-US): I will let your beautiful self go now, to rest.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 이제 아름다운 네가 쉴 수 있도록 보내 줄게.

English (United States)(en-US): Hello, <name>.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 안녕, <nickname>.

English (United States)(en-US): I encountered another\ninteresting sentence just now.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 아까는 또 재미있는 문장을 읽었어.

English (United States)(en-US): ‘In their unconscious, all humans are\nconvinced of their own immortality.’
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): ‘인간들은 무의식 속에서 자신의 불멸을 확신하고 있다.’

English (United States)(en-US): Apparently, humans are incapable of\nimagining themselves as completely dead.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 인간은 스스로가 완전히 죽은\n모습을 상상할 수 없다고 해.

English (United States)(en-US): <name>, can you try imagining\nyourself as dead?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): <nickname>. 한번 상상해 볼래? 네가 죽어 있는 모습을.

English (United States)(en-US): Then explain what it’s like to me.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그리고 내게 설명해 줘.

English (United States)(en-US): My death would look like this.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 나의 죽음은 이런 모습일 것만 같아....

English (United States)(en-US): I think it’s possible to imagine…
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 충분히 상상할 수 있는 것 같은데….

English (United States)(en-US): Possible to imagine? Maybe, to a certain point.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 상상할 수 있다고? 그래, 어느 정도는.

English (United States)(en-US): But as long as there’s someone looking at\nthat scene, you cannot be completely dead.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 하지만 그 모습을 바라보고 있는 누군가가\n존재하는 이상 너는 완전히 죽었다고 할 수 없지.

English (United States)(en-US): In your imagination, there must be another\n‘you’ looking at your own death.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그 상상 속엔 죽은 모습을 바라보고 있는\n또 다른 ‘나’가 반드시 존재한다는 거야.

English (United States)(en-US): Ah. I get it.|…What do you mean?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그렇구나. 이해했어.|…무슨 말이지?

English (United States)(en-US): There’s someone observing the scene of your\ndeath, right? That someone would also be you.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 네가 죽은 모습을 바라보고 있는\n관찰자가 있지? 그 시선도 바로 너야.

English (United States)(en-US): Because a ‘you’ that can see and think exists,\nthis view doesn’t see you as completely dead.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 볼 수 있고 생각할 수 있는 ‘너'가 존재하기에\n완전히 죽었다고 보지 않는 거지.

English (United States)(en-US): Isn’t it interesting?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 흥미로운 의견이지?

English (United States)(en-US): (Romantic depictions about us humans still make me blush.)|(Interesting. I feel appreciated just for accepting death.)
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): (인간에 대한 낭만적 묘사는 여전히 낯부끄러워.)|(흥미로워. 죽음을 받아들이는 마음가짐으로 인정받은 느낌.)

English (United States)(en-US): And also.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그리고 있지.

English (United States)(en-US): Since you taught me about death, I now\nfeel differently for the star of the party.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 네가 나에게 제대로 된 죽음을 알려줬기에, 파티의 주인공에게\n조금은 다른 감정을 품게 됐어. 어떤 감정일 것 같아?

English (United States)(en-US): Differently how? Tell me more.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 어떤 감정인데? 더 자세히 설명해 줘.

English (United States)(en-US): I don’t dare try to express it, even\nwith all the words I’ve learnt.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 내가 배워온 어떤 단어들을 조합해서도\n감히 표현하기 어려운 감정이야.

English (United States)(en-US): Even if I swallowed every dictionary on Earth,\nI feel I won’t be able to express it clearly.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 만약 세상의 모든 단어를 안대도 명쾌하게\n늘어놓을 수는 없을 거라는 예감이 드는.

English (United States)(en-US): I didn’t expect that from you.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 뭉치에게서 그런 말을 들을 줄이야.

English (United States)(en-US): It’s the first time I feel as if a solid\nwall of sadness is blocking my way.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 단단한 슬픔의 벽에 가로 막힌\n듯한 기분은 나도 처음이거든.

English (United States)(en-US): Listen. Think of any certain end you remember.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 이건 네가 기억하는 그 어떤\n종말을 상상하며 들어도 좋아.

English (United States)(en-US): Let your body rest and take my hand, go on.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 몸을 편안하게 하고, 자, 내 손을 잡아 봐.

English (United States)(en-US): Maybe just figuratively, I mean.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 물론 정말로 잡는 건 추천하지 않지만.

English (United States)(en-US): (Take Dot’s hand figuratively.)|(Actually take Dot’s long hands.)
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): (뭉치의 손을 잡는 상상을 했다.)|(정말로 뭉치의 기다란 손을 잡아주었다.)

English (United States)(en-US): Some things are so heavy that it cannot be\ndiluted, so dark that it cannot be painted over.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 짙어서 희석될 수 없고,\n깊어서 채색될 수도 없는,

English (United States)(en-US): Loss, futility, emptiness…
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 상실, 허무, 공허 같은 것들….

English (United States)(en-US): Things that dare not be put into words.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 세상엔 감히 말로 표현될\n수 없는 것들도 있더라.

English (United States)(en-US): Things that no one can bear to touch upon,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 차마 손을 댈 수가 없어서

English (United States)(en-US): and thus must be left as they are.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그냥 그대로 둬야 하고, 둘 수밖에 없는 것들.

English (United States)(en-US): Let’s stay still. Let’s just stay still.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 우리 가만히 있자. 오늘은 가만히만 있자.

English (United States)(en-US): I want to leave them as they are. The\ndead human, the loss, the futility.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그대로 두고 싶어. 그 죽어\n버린 인간을, 상실을, 허무를.

English (United States)(en-US): The toast halted mid-air, the\ncelebration stopped mid-song.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 들지 못한 축배를, 끝맺지 못한 축가를.

English (United States)(en-US): Leave them as they are,\nclose our eyes, and look on.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 전부 그대로 둔 채 눈 감고 바라보자.
